page.title: 17The Glassworks [continued]
page.content: The glassworkers take a metal stick and place it in a kiln where the temperature is between 1240 degrees C And 1500 degrees C.It then comes out with what looks like a ball of fire on the top.This ball is blown into shape using tools made out of pear wood[which is the only tool made of wood which wonÂ£t burn] and metal tongs.They make the glass shape and leave it to cool. Upstairs the cutting is done.First the little part of the glass which has been attached to the stick is cut off by the gas flame.The top of the glass will still be quite sharp so it is put into a sort of kiln on a wheel which makes the top smooth.Black felt tip lines are then put onto the glass so that the cutters know where to put the engraving marks.The glasses are held by the cutter onto a wheel which has an edge made of diamond so it cuts well.
